documentation.content:
## Example: Complete KGoT Processing Workflow

```bash
./process-bookmarks.sh kgot
./process-bookmarks.sh kgot-export
./process-bookmarks.sh kgot-import
```

## Example: Process Recent Bookmarks with Custom Options

```bash
./process-bookmarks.sh custom "--start-date=2023-06-01" "--format=json" "--output-file=summer-bookmarks.json"
```

## Standard Bookmark Processing

```bash
./process-bookmarks.sh standard
```

## Prepare Sample Data

```bash
# Create a sample data file
cat > data-bookmark-sample.jsonl << EOF
{"id": 1, "url": "https://github.com/example/repo", "source": "github", "created_at": "2025-01-01T12:00:00Z", "content": "Example GitHub Repository", "metadata": {"language": "Python", "stars": 100, "forks": 10}}
{"id": 2, "url": "https://twitter.com/example/status/12345", "source": "twitter", "created_at": "2025-01-02T12:00:00Z", "content": "Example Tweet", "metadata": {"likes": 50, "retweets": 10}}
EOF

# Copy to the main data file
cp data-bookmark-sample.jsonl data-bookmark.jsonl
```

## Knowledge Extraction Approaches

```APIDOC
Knowledge Extraction:
  Direct Retrieval (DR): Solve the task by directly embedding the knowledge graph in the LLM's context.
  Graph Query: Query the graph store for specific insights using a Graph Query.
```

## Running the Development Server

```bash
npm run dev
# or
yarn dev
# or
pnpm dev
# or
bun dev
```

## Example: Process GitHub Bookmarks to Markdown

```bash
./process-bookmarks.sh github
./process-bookmarks.sh markdown
```

## KGoT Bookmark Processing

```bash
./process-bookmarks.sh kgot
```

## GitHub Bookmark Processing

```bash
./process-bookmarks.sh github
```

## Database Folder Permissions and Ownership

```bash
cd visualization/backend/db/

ls -la
# drwxrwx---  3 root  vboxsf  96 Jun 25 17:12 .
# drwxrwx---  3 root  vboxsf  96 Jun 25 17:12 ..
# drwxrwx---  3 root  vboxsf  96 Jun 25 17:27 import

cd visualization

# Allow everyone to have access
chmod -R 777 backend/db/import 
# Change ownership of the folder
chown -R [OWNER]:[GROUP] backend/db/import
```
